Meetings/02-06-2007

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Previous meeting

All meetings

T

Next meeting


Notes

Everyones notes that were collected during the past weeks.

Pros 

Maintains relevance of Peragro Tempus name. (Induane)
Explorable history is fun and interesting. (Induane)
Allows for quests and stories that are very expansive even across an entire century. (Induane)
Ability to interact with historical figures. (Induane)
Makes story more unique (Induane)
Mystery of differences between times would encourage players to want to learn about the game and about the history.  History is often ignored in many games. (Induane)
Immersive story line, you can actually live it instead of reading some immense text. (sueastside)
A well defined world to do Role Playing in as everyone will know the story as it is part of the gameplay. (sueastside)
More creative diversity possible in artwork aswell as settings. (sueastside)
Unique Selling Point (dingobloo)
Can Be used to channel players through areas which may be harder in one time period (dingobloo)
Interesting Story elements. (dingobloo)
If the times are distinct enough allows for good equipment/game play/creature variation (dingobloo)
Living history more interesting than reading background history on the website or in a manual (sub-point: We can show chronological progression (although this may be very subtle)) (iceeey)
Interesting quests where you need to travel in time rather than just space to solve. (iceeey)
More variations in style - it's more refreshing to see both a thriving civilization and a bleak aftermath than just one of them. (iceeey)
I think it'll be cool (ok, this is the reason any of us are working on Peragro, right? (iceeey)
Partly unique feature which allows for interesting story elements (thebolt)
Give us opportunity to create content and settings for both some older and some more modern setting. (thebolt)
Some "undefined" prehistory can be both explained and shown due to multiple timelines. (thebolt)

Cons 

More work for artists. (Induane)
More difficult to implement. (Induane)
Potentially confusing if implemented wrong. (Induane)
Possibility of introducing paradoxes. (Induane)
Could be prohibitively difficult. (Induane)
Considerable more work to build a reasonable sized world, as you'll have to build 2. (sueastside)
Static versus dynamic world. (sueastside)
More content, although less if you consider a single time period of the same size due to reuse (dingobloo)
Only 100years doesn't seem enough to seem to warrant a different time period if one cannot affect the other (dingobloo)
Has been done before. (dingobloo)
i guess my only con is that we have to think a bit more about how to do it (iceeey)
Might be hard, if even possible, to clearly define how it interacts with other elements such as dynamic world structure (thebolt)
Can be confusing if not done in a pretty linear fashion. (thebolt)
Requires more content (thebolt)

Irrelevant / unimportant / invalidated

Pros 

Maintains relevance of Peragro Tempus name. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Allows for quests and stories that are very expansive even across an entire century. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Ability to interact with historical figures. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Makes story more unique (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Immersive story line, you can actually live it instead of reading some immense text. (sueastside)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Interesting Story elements. (dingobloo)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Partly unique feature which allows for interesting story elements (thebolt)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Mystery of differences between times would encourage players to want to learn about the game and about the history.  History is often ignored in many games. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Living history more interesting than reading background history on the website or in a manual (sub-point: We can show chronological progression (although this may be very subtle)) (iceeey)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Some "undefined" prehistory can be both explained and shown due to multiple time lines. (thebolt)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (3) More creative diversity possible in artwork as well as settings. (sueastside)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (3) If the times are distinct enough allows for good equipment/game play/creature variation (dingobloo)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (3) More variations in style - it's more refreshing to see both a thriving civilization and a bleak aftermath than just one of them. (iceeey)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (3) Give us opportunity to create content and settings for both some older and some more modern setting. (thebolt)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (4) A well defined world to do Role Playing in as everyone will know the story as it is part of the game play. (sueastside)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (4) Can Be used to channel players through areas which may be harder in one time period (dingobloo)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (4) Interesting quests where you need to travel in time rather than just space to solve. (iceeey)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (5) I think it'll be cool (ok, this is the reason any of us are working on Peragro, right? (iceeey)

Cons 

More work for artists. (Induane)
Considerable more work to build a reasonable sized world, as you'll have to build 2. (sueastside)
More content, although less if you consider a single time period of the same size due to reuse (dingobloo)
Requires more content (thebolt)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (1) i guess my only con is that we have to think a bit more about how to do it (iceeey)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (1) More difficult to implement. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (1) Might be hard, if even possible, to clearly define how it interacts with other elements such as dynamic world structure (thebolt)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (1) Could be prohibitively difficult. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Potentially confusing if implemented wrong. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Possibility of introducing paradoxes. (Induane)
--> Moved/combined to/with story (2) Can be confusing if not done in a pretty linear fashion. (thebolt)
Has been done before. (dingobloo)
Only 100years doesn't seem enough to seem to warrant a different time period if one cannot affect the other (dingobloo)
Static versus dynamic world. (sueastside)


Conclusion

From the above lists we concluded that the following list is the most correct:

Pros

  • Explorable history is fun and interesting.
  • Interesting story lining over multiple times.
  • More diverse artwork and possibilities.
  • Interesting game play / role play.
  • Unique Selling Point.

Cons

  • Might be more difficult.
  • Possibly unfamiliar for players at first.

The above basicly says enough but for those we need it: We are going to use multiple times even though we might encounter difficulties.
